A campaign to reopen a Borders rail link has been backed by a Scottish government minister.

The Waverley Line, which ran between Edinburgh and Carlisle, closed in 1969.

A feasibility study is being carried out into the possibility of reopening the route and Transport Minister Humza Yousaf has now thrown his weight behind the campaign.

He said the Scottish government would "look favourably" on any business case put forward.

The Waverley Line was closed as part of the Beeching cuts, which saw the axe fall on thousands of miles of railway across the UK in the 1960s.

The Borders Railway, which reopened a section of the old Waverley Line between Edinburgh and Tweedbank in 2015, has sparked fresh interest in the possibility of restoring the full route.

A feasibility study is being carried out by a group of local authorities, transport bodies and community groups.

Speaking during a visit to Galashiels, Mr Yousaf said the Scottish government would "look very favourably" on any business case that was put forward.

He added: "The Borders Railway has been an incredible success story. It has been transformational for the Borders, not just in terms of connectivity but also economically.

"The Scottish government is very keen to see what the business case looks like for taking the railway further south.

"We are working very closely with the group that is taking this forward and we will look very favourably on any business case that comes to us."

It's the third instalment of the Harry Potter film series and by far the darkest.

The opening scenes, in which Harry's parents are killed by Lord Voldemort, are genuinely chilling and set the tone for the rest of the film.

Azkaban is the wizard prison and it's from here that the evil Sirius Black escapes, determined to kill Harry.

Potter is played once again by Daniel Radcliffe and he's joined by new members of the cast including Gary Oldman as Sirius Black and David Thewlis as the Defence Against the Dark Arts teacher, Professor Lupin.

The film is packed with action and special effects but, at its heart, it's a coming-of-age story about a young boy who's struggling to come to terms with his parents' death.

The third Harry Potter film is the best so far and it's sure to be a huge hit with fans of the book and the previous films.

Guidelines on how people can defend themselves against burglars have been issued by the Home Office.

The advice includes using a door chain or bar, keeping valuables out of sight and sounding an alarm if possible.

It follows a review of the law on householders' use of force against intruders, carried out after the case of Norfolk farmer Tony Martin.

Mr Martin shot dead a burglar at his home in 1999 and was sentenced to life in prison, although he was later freed on licence.

...

The Home Office guidance says people should call the police as soon as possible if they believe a burglary is taking place.

If they cannot do so, they should try to make sure the intruder cannot escape and then leave the property and call the police from a safe location.

Householders should not put themselves in danger and should not try to apprehend the intruder, the guidance says.

It adds that the use of force against an intruder is "likely to be lawful" if people believe they are in imminent danger of violence and there is "no other reasonable way to defend themselves".

However, the use of force is "unlikely to be lawful" if people know the intruder is "going to leave the premises immediately", the guidance says.

Arsenal manager Arsene Wenger has offered Chelsea striker Adrian Mutu hope of resurrecting his career.

Mutu, 28, was sacked by the Blues in 2004 after testing positive for cocaine and has since had spells with Juventus, Fiorentina and Cesena.

The Romanian is currently without a club but Wenger believes he has "the talent to play at the top".

"He has been through a lot and sometimes you come out of these situations a better person," Wenger told BBC Sport.

"He has the talent to play at the top. I don't know what his situation is at the moment, but he has all the attributes to play at the top."

Mutu has been dogged by problems off the pitch throughout his career and was given a seven-month suspended jail sentence in 2012 for assault and causing grievous bodily harm.

Wenger, who signed Mutu for Parma in 2000, believes the striker has the potential to overcome his troubles and revive his career.

"When you are a footballer, you have responsibility," said Wenger. "But it doesn't mean that when you make a mistake, you are not a top-class footballer any more.

"I think he has learned from his mistakes and he has the talent to come back."

The world's biggest brewer, Anheuser-Busch InBev, has agreed to buy the 50% it does not already own of Russia's leading beer maker, Sun InBev, for $2.9bn (1.4bn).

The deal gives it control of Sun's brands, which include the best-selling Klinskoye beer.

The Sun InBev deal comes as InBev tries to reduce its reliance on the US market, where it generates about 40% of its sales.

InBev's existing Russian business will be merged into Sun InBev.

The deal is still subject to regulatory approval but is expected to be completed by the end of the year.

InBev has been trying to expand in emerging markets as growth in the US slows. In March, it completed the takeover of Mexico's Grupo Modelo, giving it control of the Corona beer brand.

Sun InBev was created in 2006 when InBev bought Russian brewing assets from Belgium's Interbrew.

The US Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) is investigating the activities of Marsh, the world's biggest insurance broker.

It follows a string of problems at the company, which is also facing a criminal probe in the US.

In a filing with the SEC, Marsh said it was co-operating with the investigation.

The company has already been fined by US and UK regulators over an insurance scheme that rig bids.

In the latest filing, Marsh said the SEC was looking into its "historical placement of capacity for certain clients in the London market".

It added that the SEC was also investigating its "use of contingent commissions" - the payments it receives from insurers for business referrals.

 Marsh has been embroiled in a series of scandals in recent years.

In 2005, it agreed to pay $850m (426m) to settle charges that it helped insurers rig bids for contracts to insure corporate America.

Last year, the company was fined 5m by UK regulators for misleading customers about the way it arranged cover for them.

A collection of early recordings by Elvis Presley is to go on sale for the first time.

The acetate discs, which date from 1953 and 1954, feature Presley singing covers of popular songs of the day.

They were recorded at Sun Studio in Memphis, where Presley made his first recordings in 1954.

The collection, which is being auctioned by Bonhams in New York on 12 December, is expected to fetch up to $300,000 (186,000).

The discs were owned by Marion Keisker, the studio's secretary, who was also Presley's first manager.

Keisker gave the recordings to her son, Terry, before she died in 1989.

He said he had decided to sell them now because "it's time".

"My mom always said that when the time is right, it will present itself, and I think the time is right," he told the Associated Press news agency.

The recordings feature Presley singing covers of popular songs of the day, including "My Happiness" and "That's When Your Heartaches Begin".

They were made on an acetate disc, which is a fragile material that was used to make test recordings before commercial release.

The collection also includes a letter from Presley to Keisker, thanking her for her help in getting his career started.

Shoppers have been flocking to the tills as they search for Christmas gifts, with spending on the high street up 1.6% compared with a year ago.

According to the latest figures from the British Retail Consortium (BRC), total retail sales increased by 2.6% in December, driven by strong growth in food sales.

Footfall in retail parks and shopping centres also rose last month, by 1.4% and 0.9% respectively.

The BRC said that retailers had experienced a "mixed bag" in terms of trading over the Christmas period, with some doing better than others.

"In general, food retailers had a strong Christmas, while those selling items such as clothes and electricals reported a more challenging time," said BRC chief executive Helen Dickinson.

"With consumer confidence remaining relatively low and many households still feeling the squeeze on their finances, it is clear that intense promotional activity and deep discounting were needed to drive footfall and spending in the crucial Christmas period."

Dickinson added that retailers would be hoping for a "boost" from the post-Christmas sales, which got underway in earnest on Boxing Day.

A company that helped build Wembley Stadium says it is unlikely to make a profit on the project. Multiplex said it expected to make a loss of A$40m (16.4m) on the job in its half-year results. The firm has been dogged by problems, including a fire that destroyed part of the roof.

The Australian company has also been in dispute with Wembley's owners, the Football Association (FA), over cost overruns.

In a statement, Multiplex said it was "disappointed" with the result but that the stadium was "on track to be delivered on time and within budget".

The company added that it was in "constructive discussions" with the FA about the final cost of the project.

Wembley Stadium is due to open in early 2007.

I've been depressed for so long, I don't think I can even recover from it. I've been on medication for years, and it's just not helping. I've been to therapy, and it's just not helping. I've tried everything, and nothing seems to work. I'm just so tired of being depressed, and I don't know what to do anymore.

I've been interviewing for a position that I really want for the past few weeks. The position is for a company that I really want to work for, and it's in my desired field. I've been through a few rounds of interviews and I thought I was doing well.

However, I was just told by the hiring manager that the position has been changed and they are no longer looking for someone with my skill set. They are now looking for someone with a different skill set. I'm obviously disappointed, but I'm also confused.

Why would they change the position after I've already interviewed for it? And why would they not tell me earlier that they were changing the position? It seems like a waste of time for both me and the company.

Has anyone else had a similar experience?

I'm not sure what's going on, but I've started to wake up at night again. I'll be in the middle of a dream and then I'll just wake up. It's really frustrating because I can never go back to sleep right away. I end up just lying in bed for hours before I can fall back asleep.

Has anyone else experienced this? Any tips on how to fall back asleep quickly?

I am a 20 year old student and I have been with my boyfriend for a year and a half. I love him very much and I know he loves me too. We have a great relationship but there is one problem, he doesn't want to have sex with me. There's a lot of misinformation out there about VA panels. I'm here to clear some things up.

First, let's talk about what a VA panel is. VA (vertical alignment) is a type of LCD panel. It's different from the more popular IPS (in-plane switching) and TN (twisted nematic) panels in a few key ways.

First, VA panels have much better contrast ratios than IPS and TN panels. This means that they can display darker blacks and brighter whites. They also have much better viewing angles than TN panels, meaning that you can view the screen from different angles without losing image quality.

However, VA panels also have some drawbacks. First, they tend to have slower response times than TN panels. This means that there may be some ghosting and blurring when you're playing fast-paced games or watching action movies.

Second, VA panels tend to suffer from a phenomenon called "black crush." This means that when you're trying to display dark colors, they can appear to "crush" or appear as a single color instead of a gradient.

Third, VA panels can have issues with image retention. This means that if you leave a static image on the screen for too long, it can become " burned-in" and be permanent.

So, why do people say VA panels are "bad"?

Well, it really depends on what you're looking for in a monitor. If you're a casual user who mostly uses their PC for web browsing and watching movies, then a VA panel is a great choice. However, if you're a hardcore gamer or a professional who needs to have the fastest response time possible, then you might want to consider a TN panel instead.

There are a few things that help me when my digestive system is acting up due to histamine intolerance.

First, I make sure to drink plenty of fluids. This helps to keep things moving through my system and prevents me from getting dehydrated.

Second, I eat smaller meals more frequently throughout the day. This helps to keep my digestive system from getting overwhelmed.

Third, I make sure to include plenty of high-fiber foods in my diet. This helps to keep things moving through my system and prevents constipation.

Fourth, I avoid foods that are high in histamine. This includes fermented foods, aged cheeses, and cured meats.

Fifth, I take a daily probiotic supplement. This helps to restore the balance of good bacteria in my gut and keeps my digestive system functioning properly.

Finally, I try to manage my stress levels. This is important because stress can aggravate histamine intolerance symptoms.

I'm really tired of people making ignorant comments about snakes. I'm not even talking about people who are afraid of them, I'm talking about people who act like they know everything about them and then say really stupid things.

First of all, snakes are not "slimy." That's just gross and wrong. They are covered in scales, which are dry and smooth. Secondly, snakes are not "dangerous." Yes, some snakes are venomous, but that doesn't make them dangerous. Venomous snakes will only bite humans if they feel threatened, and even then, most bites are not fatal.

Third, snakes are not "disgusting." I don't know why people think this, but it's just not true. Snakes are beautiful, amazing creatures that are an important part of the ecosystem.

Fourth, snakes are not "evil." Snakes are not out to get you, they are not trying to hurt you, and they are not trying to kill you. They are just trying to live their lives, like any other animal.

So, please, educate yourselves on snakes before you make any more ignorant comments about them.

There's a lot of misinformation out there about VA panels. I'm not going to claim to be an expert, but I'll try to clear up some of the misconceptions.

First of all, VA panels are not "bad." They have their own set of advantages and disadvantages, just like any other type of panel. The main advantage of VA panels is their excellent contrast ratios. This means that they can display very deep blacks, which is great for watching movies or playing video games.

However, VA panels also have some disadvantages. One is that they tend to have poorer color accuracy than other types of panels. This means that colors may not look as accurate on a VA panel as they would on an IPS or TN panel. Additionally, VA panels can suffer from "ghosting" artifacts, where fast-moving objects leave behind a trail of light.

Overall, VA panels are a good choice for people who want excellent contrast ratios and don't mind sacrificing some color accuracy.

It's been a little while since we've done a theme update, so we figured it was time to give you all a heads up on what's been going on behind the scenes.

First off, we want to thank everyone who has been playing and enjoying the game. It's been amazing to see the game grow and evolve over the past year, and we're excited to see what the future holds.

One of the things we've been working on is a new theme for the game. We're calling it "The Year of Foundation."

This theme will be focused on the founding of the game, and the events that led up to it. We'll be exploring the backstories of some of the game's most important characters, and delving into the mysteries of the world itself.

We're also introducing a new game mechanic with this theme. Foundation Points are a new resource that can be used to purchase special foundation cards. These cards will be used to build up your deck, and give you new ways to interact with the game.

We're really excited about this new theme, and we think it's going to be a great addition to the game. We'll have more information to share in the coming weeks, so stay tuned!

It's tough. I've been there. I still am there, to be honest. I'm not sure if there's a "right" way to do it, but I can tell you what has helped me.

First, I had to accept that my self-esteem was low. That was a hard pill to swallow, but it was necessary. I had to come to terms with the fact that I didn't feel good about myself.

Second, I started to focus on the things that I was good at. I made a list of all the things I was proud of, no matter how small. I started to believe that I was good at something.

Third, I started to do things that made me feel good. I started to exercise, to eat better, to dress nicer. I did things that made me feel good about myself.

Fourth, I started to talk to myself differently. I started to tell myself that I was worth it, that I was good enough. I started to believe it.

It's a process, and it's not always easy. But it's worth it.

I work with a small group of people who are investigating Mars and specifically the Cydonia region. We have been working with Mars images for many years and have found some very strange and unexplained anomalies.

We have recently come across something that we believe may be a door or portal of some kind. We have found what appears to be a rectangular structure that has been cut into a hillside. The dimensions of the structure are approximately 3 metres wide by 2 metres tall.

We have no idea what this structure is or what its purpose may be. We are calling it the "Mars 4 portal". We are not suggesting that this is definitely a portal or that aliens built it. We are simply saying that it is a strange and unexplained object and we would like to know more about it.

We are asking for help from the Reddit community. We would like to know if anyone has any ideas about what this object could be. We would also like to know if anyone has any experience with image analysis or Mars research and could help us to investigate this further.

Thank you for your time and we look forward to hearing from you.

Ace was a member of the beast pirates. He was their second captain and one of the four Yonko. He was also the brother of Sabo, the Revolutionary Army's chief of staff.

Ace was born to a noble family in Goa Kingdom. When he was still a baby, his mother died from an illness. His father, who was a Marine, was arrested and sentenced to death for a crime he didn't commit. Ace and his brother, Sabo, were then orphaned and left to fend for themselves.

Ace and Sabo eventually met and became friends with a boy named Luffy. The three of them swore an oath of brotherhood and promised to become pirates together.

Ace eventually left the group to join the Whitebeard Pirates. He quickly rose through the ranks and became one of their most powerful members.

Ace was eventually captured by the Marines and sentenced to execution. He was saved by his brother, Sabo, but was mortally wounded in the process. He died in Luffy's arms, asking him to protect Sabo.

If you don't have bluetooth, you're not out of luck. There are a few ways you can still use your favorite wireless headphones with your phone.

First, you can use a wired headset. This will require an adapter that goes from the 3.5mm headphone jack on your phone to the 2.5mm input on your headphones. You can find these adapters online or at your local electronics store.

Second, you can use a wireless adapter. These adapters plug into the headphone jack on your phone and then broadcast a signal that your headphones can pick up. You can find these adapters online or at your local electronics store.

Third, you can use a FM transmitter. These devices plug into the headphone jack on your phone and then broadcast a signal over FM frequencies that your car stereo can pick up. You can find these devices online or at your local electronics store.

Fourth, you can use a cassette adapter. These adapters plug into the headphone jack on your phone and then let you play your music through your car's cassette player. You can find these adapters online or at your local electronics store.

Finally, you can use a docking station. These devices plug into the headphone jack on your phone and then provide a docking port for your headphones. You can find these devices online or at your local electronics store.

As an adult, making friends can be difficult. You might have trouble finding people with similar interests, or you may feel like you don't have the time to invest in making new friends. Here are a few suggestions for making friends as an adult:

1. Join a club or organization. This is a great way to meet people with similar interests. There are clubs and organizations for just about everything, so you're sure to find one that's a good fit for you.

2. Attend social events. Whether it's a party, a concert, or a sports event, attending social events is a great way to meet new people.

3. Get involved in your community. Volunteering, joining a sports league, or taking a class are all great ways to meet new people and make friends.

4. Connect with old friends. Keeping in touch with old friends is a great way to make new friends. If you've lost touch with some old friends, reach out and reconnect.

5. Use social media. Social media can be a great way to connect with people who share your interests.

Making friends as an adult can be difficult, but it's definitely possible. By getting involved in your community, attending social events, and staying connected with old friends, you'll be on your way to making new friends in no time.

I was diagnosed with PCOS about a year ago and one of the main things my doctor told me to do was to change my diet. I was eating a lot of processed and sugary foods and she told me that I needed to cut those out if I wanted to improve my PCOS symptoms.

It was really hard at first because I loved those foods and I didn't want to give them up. But I knew that if I wanted to feel better, I had to make some changes.

I started by cutting out processed foods and eating more whole foods. I also cut out sugary drinks and replaced them with water or unsweetened tea. And I made sure to get in plenty of protein and healthy fats.

It took a while to get used to the new way of eating, but now I feel so much better. My PCOS symptoms have improved and I have more energy. I'm so glad I made the changes!

Bipolar disorder and bisexuality can both be difficult to manage on their own, but when you combine the two, it can be even more challenging. For me, the biggest issue is the fact that I often swing between wanting to be alone and wanting to be in a relationship.

When I'm in a relationship, I'm constantly afraid that I'm not good enough for my partner or that I'm going to do something to screw things up. I often feel like I'm not worthy of love and that eventually my partner is going to realize that and leave me.

This can lead to me pushing my partner away or becoming overly needy and clingy. I can also swing from being really happy and in love to feeling like I want to just end it all because I'm not good enough.

It's a constant rollercoaster ride and it can be really tough on both me and my partner. If you're in a relationship with someone who has bipolar disorder and is bisexual, here are some tips that may help you:

1. Be patient and understanding.

Bipolar disorder can be a very difficult illness to manage and your partner may have good days and bad days. It's important to be patient and understanding with them.

2. Communicate.

Communication is key in any relationship, but it's especially important when one or both partners have bipolar disorder. Make sure to talk about your feelings and needs with each other.

3. Get help.

If you're struggling to cope with your partner's bipolar disorder, don't be afraid to seek professional help. There are many resources available to help you both manage the condition.

4. Take care of yourself.

It's important to take care of yourself both physically and mentally. Make sure to eat a balanced diet, exercise, and get enough sleep. Consider talking to a therapist or counselor if you're feeling overwhelmed.

5. Be supportive.

Your partner is likely going through a lot emotionally, so it's important to be supportive. Offer a shoulder to cry on, lend a listening ear, and just be there for them.

Bipolar disorder and bisexuality can both be difficult to deal with, but it's important to remember that you're not alone. There are many resources available to help you and your partner cope with the condition.

If I'm interested in lending my shares to an institution through a broker, what are some key things I should be aware of?

The first thing you should be aware of is the lending agreement. This agreement will outline the terms of the loan, including the interest rate, the duration of the loan, and any other pertinent information. It is important to read and understand this agreement before signing it.

Another thing to keep in mind is the risks associated with lending your shares. There is always the risk that the borrower will default on the loan, which could result in you losing your shares. There is also the possibility that the value of the shares will go down while they are being lent, which could again result in a loss for you.

Finally, you need to be aware of the tax implications of lending your shares. In most cases, the interest you earn on the loan will be considered taxable income. Be sure to speak with a tax professional before embarking on this type of transaction to make sure you understand all of the implications.

I'm not entirely sure, but I think it has something to do with the fact that the blender developers have never really designed or implemented a crease set tool.

There are a few ways to create creases in blender, but none of them are particularly easy or straightforward. The best way that I've found is to use the Knife tool in Edit mode.

First, select the vertices that you want to be in the crease set. Then, press K and select Knife from the menu that appears.

Next, press Shift + LMB to select a point on the mesh that you want to be the center of the crease set. Finally, press Enter to confirm your selection and create the crease set.

There are a few ways to do this, but the most common is to use a proxy server. This is a server that sits between your computer and the internet, and all your traffic goes through it. The server then makes the request to the website on your behalf, and the website sees the proxy server's IP address instead of yours.

There are many free proxy servers available, but they are often slow and unreliable. If you're serious about hiding your IP address, you'll want to use a paid proxy service. These services are much faster and more reliable, but they cost money.

Another way to hide your IP address is to use a VPN (virtual private network). This is a private network that encrypts all your traffic and routes it through a server in another location. This makes it impossible for anyone to see your real IP address.

VPNs are more expensive than proxy servers, but they're much more secure. If you're concerned about your privacy, a VPN is the best way to go.

It's been a little over a year since I lost my old self. I was in a relationship for 5 years and I was completely devoted to her. I was also going to school full time and working 2 jobs. I was constantly busy and never had any time for myself. I was always tired and stressed out. My health was also declining due to the lack of sleep and poor diet.

Eventually, I just couldn't take it anymore and I ended the relationship. It was the hardest thing I've ever done, but I knew it was for the best. I also quit my jobs and took a break from school. I moved back in with my parents and I had to start over.

It's been a tough year, but I'm slowly starting to feel like myself again. I'm still not where I want to be, but I'm getting there. Here are a few things that have helped me:

1) Don't dwell on the past: It's easy to dwell on the good times and forget about the bad times. However, it's important to remember that the relationship is over and you need to move on.

2) Find a new hobby: This is a great way to distract yourself from the pain of the breakup. It can also help you to find yourself again.

3) Spend time with friends and family: They will be there for you when you need them.

4) Get out and do things: Go for walks, go to the gym, go out with friends. Just get out of the house and do something.

5) Be patient: It takes time to heal. Don't expect to be back to your old self overnight. It will take time, but you will get there.

COVID-19 has created an uncertain future for many businesses, but it has also created opportunities for those who are willing to adapt and pivot their business models.

My digital marketing agency was one of the businesses that was able to take advantage of the opportunities presented by COVID-19.

When the pandemic first hit, many of our clients were forced to shutter their businesses or drastically reduce their budgets.

However, we quickly realized that there was still a demand for our services, even in a down economy.

We started to focus on helping our clients adapt their businesses to the new reality of COVID-19.

This meant helping them move their businesses online, creating new content to connect with their customers, and finding ways to reach their customers through digital channels.

As a result of our efforts, we were able to not only weather the storm, but actually grow our business during the pandemic.

If you're looking for opportunities to grow your business during COVID-19, I encourage you to think outside the box and adapt to the new reality.

Battlestar Galactica is one of the most popular shows on television, and with good reason. It's a smart, well-written show with great characters and awesome special effects. But there's one thing that's always bugged me about the show: the fact that the titular Battlestar is apparently dead.

Now, I know that the show is set in a post-apocalyptic future, and that the Battlestar was destroyed in the war that wiped out humanity. But I can't help but wonder if the show's creators are leaving the door open for the possibility that the Battlestar is still out there somewhere, waiting to be found.

There are a few things that make me think this might be the case. First of all, the show's opening narration always refers to the Battlestar as "the last of the Colonial Fleet." This implies that there may be other Battlestars out there that we don't know about.

Secondly, the show's main character, William Adama, is always talking about how he wishes he could find the Battlestar. It's possible that he knows something we don't.

Finally, the show's finale ended with the Battlestar's voice saying, "So say we all." This could be interpreted as the Battlestar's way of saying goodbye to the humans it once protected.

Of course, this is all just speculation. But it's fun to think about, and it would be awesome if it turned out to be true.

I had my first baby 6 months ago. For the first few months, I was in a state of complete and utter exhaustion. I was so sleep deprived that I could barely function. I would have these brief moments of lucidity where I would be able to think clearly and function like a normal human being, but they would be quickly followed by periods of complete exhaustion where I could barely keep my eyes open. I would often find myself nodding off while nursing my baby or even while holding her.

It was during one of these periods of exhaustion that I began to experience what I now know to be post partum depression. I would find myself crying for no reason, feeling completely overwhelmed and hopeless. I would have intrusive thoughts about harming myself or my baby. I felt like I was a terrible mother and that I was never going to be able to do this.

Thankfully, I had a very supportive partner who was there for me every step of the way. He would often take over when I was too exhausted to function and he would help me to get the rest that I so desperately needed.

Eventually, I started to feel better and my energy levels began to increase. I slowly started to feel like myself again.

Now, 6 months later, I am doing much better. I still have my moments of exhaustion, but they are few and far between. I am able to function like a normal human being most of the time.

If you are a new parent and you are feeling exhausted, please know that this is completely normal. It is also normal to feel like you are not doing enough or like you are failing. These feelings do not mean that you are a bad parent. They are simply a result of the immense amount of stress that comes along with this new role.

If you are feeling depressed or hopeless, please reach out for help. There is no shame in admitting that you need help. Post partum depression is very real and it is nothing to be ashamed of.

If you are struggling, please know that you are not alone. There are many resources available to help you through this difficult time.

Looking for an alternative to the Cascade Loop in Washington state. Something with a similar feel, maybe a little less crowded.

The Cascades offer a variety of different hiking experiences, from the strenuous climbs of Mt. Adams and Mt. Rainier to the more relaxed hikes through old growth forests and along rushing rivers. Depending on what you're looking for, here are a few other hikes in the Cascades that might be worth checking out:

- The Enchantments in Central Washington offer stunning alpine lakes, meadows, and peaks, and are best accessed via a multi-day backpacking trip.

- The Olympics also have a lot to offer in terms of scenery and wildlife, and there are a number of different loops and circuits you can hike depending on your fitness level and time frame.

- Another option closer to Seattle is the Wonderland Trail, a 93-mile loop around Mt. Rainier that can take anywhere from 3-14 days to complete.

"Quin mat a Sara?" is a popular Spanish-language telenovela that aired on Univision from May 6, 2019 to August 13, 2019. The series follows Sara Aguilar (played by Cassandra Ciangherotti), a wealthy young socialite who is murdered, and the events that occur after her death.

The show was a huge success in the Hispanic community, with many viewers tuning in to find out who killed Sara. The series finale left many questions unanswered, however, and fans are still trying to figure out who the killer is.

There are many theories about who killed Sara, and no one knows for sure who did it. However, there are a few suspects who are widely believed to be the most likely culprits.

The most popular theory is that Sara's husband, Antonio Aguilar (played by Alberto Guerra), killed her. This theory is based on the fact that Antonio was having an affair with Sara's best friend, Ruth Lpez (played by Mayra Couto), and that he stood to gain a large amount of money from Sara's death.

Another theory suggests that Sara's brother, Javier Aguilar (played by Alejandro Aguilar), killed her. This theory is based on the fact that Javier was jealous of Sara's relationship with Antonio, and that he resented her for not spending more time with him.

Finally, there is a theory that Sara's maid, Alicia Jimnez (played by Paulina Gmez), killed her. This theory is based on the fact that Alicia was seen arguing with Sara shortly before her death, and that she had access to the murder weapon.

Whoever killed Sara, one thing is for sure: the mystery surrounding her death is still unsolved.

You know the saying, "Get your house in order before you criticize others"? Well, I'm starting to think that maybe we need to take that saying a step further and actually figure out HOW to get our houses in order before we start criticizing others.

I'm not perfect, and I know I have a lot of work to do on myself before I can start pointing fingers at anyone else. But I also know that I'm not the only one in this boat. We all have our own houses to clean up, and we all need to start somewhere.

So, how do we get our houses in order? How do we become the best versions of ourselves?

Here are a few ideas to get you started:

1. Be honest with yourself.

This is probably the most important step. You need to be honest about the areas in your life that need work. If you're not honest with yourself, you'll never be able to improve.

2. Set realistic goals.

Don't try to change everything at once. That's just setting yourself up for failure. Start with small goals that you can actually achieve. Once you start seeing results, you'll be motivated to keep going.

3. Get rid of the negative influences in your life.

Surround yourself with positive people who will support your efforts to improve. Get rid of the toxic people in your life who bring you down.

4. Find a role model.

Find someone who has already achieved what you're trying to achieve and learn from them. See how they did it and what they did to stay on track.

5. Take action.

You can't just sit around and wait for things to happen. You need to take action and make things happen. The only way to improve your life is to take action and make positive changes.

These are just a few ideas to get you started. The most important thing is to just get started. Don't wait for the perfect time or the perfect circumstances. Just start taking action and see where it takes you.

Costs to rebuild the Imperial City are primarily driven by two key factors: the cost of the land and the cost of construction.

The cost of land is driven by the size of the city and the quality of the land. The size of the city is determined by the number of citizens. The quality of the land is determined by the location of the city. If the city is located on good quality land, the cost of the land will be higher. If the city is located on poor quality land, the cost of the land will be lower.

The cost of construction is determined by the type of construction. If the city is being rebuilt with new construction, the cost will be higher. If the city is being rebuilt with existing construction, the cost will be lower.
